title: Chassis ECM Diagnostic Trouble Codes

body.body: Chassis ECM Diagnostic Trouble Codes Text
Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) are logged in the chassis ECM memory when there is a confirmed fault in the system.
The codes are reported to the Triumph diagnostic tool as a four digit code.

When the system detects a fault, it begins to count the number of times the fault occurs before confirming the fault and storing a fault code. A confirmed fault may be indicated by the effected system(s) simply becoming inoperative, or by the illumination of a system warning light and/or instrument warning message.

Similarly, if a fault clears, the chassis ECM also records this fact and will extinguish any warning lights or instrument messages and restore normal operation to the affected system, when sufficient no-fault ignition switch cycles have taken place. Any fault codes will remain in the chassis ECM memory until the required number of no-fault ignition switch cycles have taken place. The number of ignition switch cycles required to restore normal operation will always be less than the number required to remove a DTC from the chassis ECM memory. DTCs can be removed at any time using the Triumph diagnostic tool.
The system will log the diagnostic trouble codes listed below:
Ignition switch cycles before clearing fault
Ignition switch cycles before DTC is erased
Chassis ECM internal power supply malfunction
Ambient temperature sensor signal under temperature
Blank or incorrect air temperature display
Ambient temperature sensor signal over temperature
Blank or incorrect air temperature display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate. Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate. Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate. Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Remaining direction indicators flash at a faster rate. Warning bulb shows in instrument display
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated grip symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated grip symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated grip symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Heated grip symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
MIL* (and coolant temperature warning light if fault long term)
MIL* (and coolant temperature warning light if fault long term)
Universal Serial Bus (USB) power socket overcurrent
Universal Serial Bus (USB) Power Socket Overcurrent
CAN fault - lost communication with instruments
CAN fault - lost communication with ABS module
CAN fault - lost communication with Engine ECM
Bike continues to run when fault logged but will not start after first ignition cycle.
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Passenger heated seat switch position one malfunction
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
Passenger heated seat switch position two malfunction
Heated seat symbol displayed on instruments but heat level indicators empty
CAN Error - No response to control module CAN communication
CAN Error - No response to control module CAN communication
Chassis ECM restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Control module restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Chassis ECM restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Control module restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Chassis ECM restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Control module restarted due to process time out during normal operation
Chassis ECM restarted due to calibration download or software timeout
Control module restarted due to calibration download
Chassis ECM parameters reset to default
Control module parameters reset to default
MIL* (and coolant temperature warning light if fault long term)
MIL* (and coolant temperature warning light if fault long term)
Brake light active low output open circuit
* MIL illuminated by engine ECM in response to chassis ECM DTC being stored.
